required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cartilage Adaptation and Response to Interleukins and Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Exercise on the Collagen Synthesis and Cytokine Response in Human Cartilage Tissue With Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the effect of exercise on the turnover of collagen in articular cartilage and the content of cytokines in the synovial fluid from human adults with osteoarthritis.

detailed_description.textblock: By using stabile isotope labelling, this study will track the formation and destination of newly formed cartilage collagen in adult humans scheduled for knee replacement surgery due to osteoarthritis. The collagen formation as well as the effect on the cytokine content of the synovial fluid will be examined both at rest and in response to 4 weeks of exercise/training. Overall the project aims to improve the basic understanding of cartilage development and function in relation to osteoarthritis prevention.

primary_outcome.description: By using incorporation of stabile isotope tracers measured by gas chromatography, the concentration of newly formed collagen will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cytokine and enzymes concentration in synovial fluid
secondary_outcome.description: By using Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) the concentration of cytokines in synovial fluid will be measured.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cytokine and enzymes concentration in blood
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning and at the end of the study at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: By using Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) the concentration of cytokines in the blood will be measured.
By using real time reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) the concentration of messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) in cartilage tissue will be measured.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning and at the end of the study at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: By calculating the total volume of weight lifted (kg) the strength will be measured.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the study.
secondary_outcome.description: BMI measured as the total body weight divided by the height squared (kg/m^2)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the beginning of the study.

intervention.description: Moderate to heavy intensity resistance exercise consisting of leg press.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary osteoarthritis of the knee scheduled for knee replacement surgery
- Must be able to perform physical exercise
- Age 40-90 years old
- BMI 18.5-40 kg/m^2
- None smoker for the last 6 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Regular intake of:
- non steroid anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID)
- corticoid-steroids
- disease modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (DMARD)
- cytostatic incl. chemotherapy
- immune suppressive medicine
- Inflammatory diseases or cancer
- Recent trauma to the knee (< 3 months)
- Previous knee surgery
- Regular strenuous exercise ( > 1 pr. month)
- Previous exposure to tracers (e.g. from another study)
